EmailTemplate.subject: Your Menu: It’s All About the Aesthetic
EmailTemplate.textOnly: Keep it simple Less is more. Don’t give your customers too many items to choose from—just give them enough options without overwhelming them. Choose your words carefully Get creative by using adjectives in your descriptions to feed your guests’ appetites—and imaginations. Strategically place menu items Put the high-profit dishes where the eye naturally goes first, and then put the slightly more expensive items at the top. Take advantage of technology If it fits with your restaurant’s theme, switch to digital menu boards, tablets or self-ordering kiosks to easily update your menu without shelling out more money to do it.
